definition: time and tide wait for no man (idiom)
surname Shi
old variant of 時|时[shi2]
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
(negative prefix)/not/no
I/me/my
to wait/to treat/to deal with/to need/going to (do sth)/about to/intending to
to stay

sentences.english: Time is not on our side. We need to keep moving forward and we need to move fast.
sentences.chinese: 时不我待，我们必须不断前进，行动迅速。

sentences.english: Many bold decisions need to be taken, and taken soon.
sentences.chinese: 需要作出许多具有胆识的决定，而且时不我待。

sentences.english: I must point out, however, that time waits for no one, so we must take action immediately.
sentences.chinese: 但是需要指出的是，时不我待，必须马上行动。

sentences.english: Yet the euro crisis will not wait.
sentences.chinese: 但是欧债危机已经时不我待。

sentences.english: So treasure every moment that you have. And remember that time waits for no one.
sentences.chinese: 所以珍惜你拥有的每一刻，切记住时不我待。

sentences.english: Indeed this is need of the hour can't wait or pause the modernisation for anbyody.
sentences.chinese: 这个的确是当前需要，军队现代化时不我待。

sentences.english: This responsibility cannot wait – we must act now.
sentences.chinese: 这一责任时不我待，我们必须现在就行动起来。

definition: to seize every minute (idiom)/to make the best use of one's time
Opportunity knocks but once. (idiom)
pinyin: ji1 bu4 ke3 shi1 , shi2 bu4 zai4 lai2

definition: Time that has passed will never come back. (idiom)
seize every minute and second (idiom); not a minute to lose/every moment counts
pressing/urgent
the future is long (idiom); there will be ample time for that later/We'll cross that bridge when we get there

lit. once you've shot the arrow, there's no getting it back (idiom)/fig. once you started sth, there's no turning back/to have to finish what one started/to be determined to reach one's goals in spite of setbacks
pinyin: kai1 gong1 mei2 you3 hui2 tou2 jian4

definition: to think of danger in times of safety/to be vigilant in peacetime (idiom)
to advance bravely/to endeavor
like rowing a boat upstream, if you stop moving forward you fall back (idiom)
pinyin: ni4 shui3 xing2 zhou1 , bu4 jin4 ze2 tui4

definition: transient/fleeting
to race against time
lit. speed is a crucial asset in war (idiom)/fig. swift and resolute (in doing sth)
to meet a challenge
lit. fight minutes, snatch seconds (idiom); a race against time/making every second count
to rouse to vigorous action/energetic mood
